name: Villa Kaliopa
must_try: Lobster linguine in the sculpture garden
notes: Hidden garden restaurant, one of the best in Croatia. Book 2 days ahead in summer.

name: Konoba Palma
must_try: Grilled octopus with potatoes under peka
notes: Right on the waterfront. Great for a long lunch after morning sail.

name: Gariful
must_try: Fresh fish platter on the harbour terrace
notes: Celebrity hotspot. Unbeatable harbour views. Expensive but worth it.

name: Pojoda
notes: Family-run for generations. Authentic island cuisine. Cash only.

name: Konoba Mate
notes: In the old town walls. Traditional stone interior.

name: Konoba Stori Komin
must_try: Catch of the day over wood fire
notes: Walk from the beach. Relaxed island vibe. Arrive early for best fish selection.

name: LD Restaurant
notes: Michelin-quality without the price. Stunning old town terrace.

name: Konoba Hvaranin
notes: Off the tourist trail. What locals actually eat. Incredible value.

name: Konoba Bako
notes: Right on the Komiža harbour. Run by a local fisherman family.

name: Bugenvila
notes: Better than most Dubrovnik restaurants at half the price. Worth the 30min sail south.

name: Restaurant Dvor
notes: Beachfront dining with Split skyline views. Perfect last-night dinner.

name: Konoba Lukin
notes: Order peka 2 hours ahead. Hidden in the old town alleyways.
